Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2011 07:20PM LaurieInDallas wrote: I have a nodule in my lung and ones on my liver and kidneys that I am told by my oncologist are caused by my Rheumatoid Arthritis.  I will have a scan in Jan or so when I have finished my tc.  I am on week 4 and shame on me took my kids to seaworld alone this weekend before taking them to camp.  OK I was in a wheelchair and wore a mask and my hair flew from my head in the wind but I kept my promise to take them and that was very important to me.  I have resolved to not worry about the nodules now because 1. worry dosent help. 2. It wont change anything. 3. ALL MY ENERGY goes to positive thinking to rid myself of cancer!!!!!!!    Hope that helps and I will be sending you lots of prayers and positive energy for healing!!!
Posts.Title: Pulmonary nodules Justina LaurieInDallas

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 01:45AM LaurieInDallas wrote: It has been really hard for my adult children to really accept how sick I am.  I think by not accepting it they can somehow protect themselves from the hurt. I am not defending them at all and I think their behavior is wrong, just cant live with that they dont care I guess... No, I dont think you are self centered at all or expecting too much, perhaps you could call your local church or synagogue and check into things like chemo angels and cleaning for a reason for support.
Posts.Title: What's Up with My Family? YaYa5 FireKracker
